trans-unit.source: We're here to help you find your pet
StraySafe is a free platform specialised in helping to find missing pets and their owners.
Begin your search through existing reports.
View reports in a convenient list format.
Visualize report locations on an interactive map.
Use image comparison and recognition algorithms to search for similar reports.
Explore statistics demonstrating the effectiveness of this platform in helping to locate lost and found pets.
Assess the Situation: First, make sure the pet is safe and not in immediate danger. Approach cautiously, especially if the pet seems scared or aggressive.
Check for Identification: Look for any tags, collars, or other forms of identification on the pet. This could provide valuable information on how to contact the owner.

Scan for Microchip: If possible, take the pet to a local veterinary clinic or animal shelter to have them scanned for a microchip. Many pets have microchips implanted under their skin, which can help identify their owners.

Take Photos and Note Details: Document the pet's appearance, including any distinctive markings or features. Take clear photos to share on social media and with local animal shelters or community groups.

Notify Authorities: Contact your local animal control, shelters, and veterinary clinics to report the found pet. They may have information on missing pets in the area or be able to assist in reuniting the pet with its owner.

Create a report on this website: Use our platform's resources to swiftly create a comprehensive seen pet report. Provide all relevant details about your pet, including breed, color, distinctive markings, and any special considerations.

Use Social Media: Share information about the found pet on social media platforms like Facebook or Instagram. Include photos, location where the pet was found, and contact information for reaching you or local authorities.

Reach Out to Local Pet Groups: Contact local pet rescue groups or community pages dedicated to lost and found pets. They may have resources and networks to help spread the word and reunite the pet with its owner.

Provide Temporary Care: If you're able to, provide temporary care for the pet while efforts are made to find its owner. Ensure the pet has food, water, and a safe place to stay until they can be reunited.

Stay Persistent and Patient: Reuniting a lost pet with its owner can take time and effort. Stay persistent in your search efforts and remain patient. Your actions could make a significant difference in bringing a beloved pet back home.
Act Quickly: Don't wait to start your search. The sooner you begin, the higher the chance of finding your pet.

Create a lost pet report in this platform: Use our platform's resources to swiftly create a comprehensive lost pet report. Provide all relevant details about your pet, including breed, color, distinctive markings, and any special considerations.

Search your lost pet among seen or found reports on this website: Use our platform's search function to browse through seen or found reports of pets in your area. You can filter the results by location or species and even view them on a map to see where sightings or discoveries have occurred. This can help you identify potential leads or sightings of your lost pet and aid in your search efforts.
Search the Immediate Area: Start by searching your home, yard, and any nearby places your pet might hide or roam.
Notify Neighbors and Local Businesses: Let your neighbors and nearby businesses know that your pet is missing. They can keep an eye out and may have seen something.

Use relevant image of your pet: Ensure that the photo you use accurately depicts your pet's appearance. Choose a clear, recent image that clearly shows their face and any distinctive features. This will help people better identify your pet if they come across them.
Use Social Media: Post a photo and description of your pet on social media platforms. Ask friends and followers to share your post to reach a wider audience.
Contact Animal Shelters and Veterinary Clinics: Reach out to local animal shelters and vet clinics to see if your pet has been brought in or reported found.

Create Lost Pet Flyers: Our platform suggests creating a flyer design based on the information provided in your report. This feature streamlines the process of generating eye-catching flyers that can be quickly printed and distributed in your community.
Search During Quiet Hours: Late at night or early in the morning, when there's less noise and activity, can be the best time to search for a lost pet.
Don't Give Up: Persistence is key. Keep searching and spreading the word. Many pets are reunited with their owners weeks or even months after going missing.
Explore a variety of useful resources suited to your problems or interests.
Practical advice and strategies for finding a missing pet.
Guidance on caring for a pet you have found.
Ways to assist in reuniting lost pets with their owners.
Ways to Help Find Lost Pets (Volunteering)
Spread Awareness: Share posts about missing pets on your social media accounts and encourage others to do the same. The more people who see the posts, the higher the chances of finding the pet.
Join Search Parties: Keep an eye out for announcements about search parties in your area and join them. Every extra pair of eyes can make a difference in finding a lost pet.
Distribute Flyers: Take flyers from local shelters or print your own from the platform and distribute them in your neighborhood, at local businesses, and on community bulletin boards.

Report Sightings: If you see a pet that matches the description of a missing one, report it immediately to the platform or local animal control. Time is of the essence in reuniting lost pets with their owners.
Share Expertise: If you have experience with animals or search and rescue operations, consider offering your expertise to help organize search efforts or provide guidance to others.
Offer Transportation: Volunteer to help transport flyers, supplies, or found pets to and from locations as needed. Your vehicle can be a valuable asset in search efforts.
Donate Supplies: Donate items such as pet food, blankets, or first aid kits to local shelters or organizations involved in the search for missing pets.
Be Vigilant: Keep an eye out for lost pet alerts in your area and be vigilant for any signs of a missing pet while you're out and about.
Attend Events: Participate in community events organized by the platform, such as fundraisers or awareness campaigns, to show your support for reuniting lost pets with their families.
Educate Others: Spread the word about responsible pet ownership and the importance of microchipping and ID tags to prevent pets from getting lost in the future.
